==Events==
*[[597 BC]] &ndash; [[Babylonians]] capture [[Jerusalem]], and replace [[Jehoiachin]] with [[Zedekiah]] as king.
* [[455]] &ndash; Emperor [[Valentinian III]] is [[Assassination|assassinated]] by two [[Huns|Hunnic]] retainers while training with the [[Bow and arrow|bow]] on the [[Campus Martius]] ([[Ancient Rome|Rome]]).
* [[934]] &ndash; [[Meng Zhixiang]] declares himself [[Emperors of China|emperor]] and establishes [[Later Shu]] as a new state independent of [[Later Tang]].
*[[1190]] &ndash; Massacre of Jews at [[York Castle|Clifford's Tower]], [[York]].
*[[1244]] &ndash; Over 200 [[Cathar]]s are burned after the [[Siege of Montségur|Fall of Montségur]].
*[[1322]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Boroughbridge]] take place in the [[Despenser War]]s.
*[[1621]] &ndash; [[Samoset]], a [[Mohegan]], visited the settlers of [[Plymouth Colony]] and greets them, "Welcome, Englishmen! My name is Samoset."
*[[1660]] &ndash; The [[Long Parliament]] of England is dissolved so as to prepare for the new [[Convention Parliament (1660)|Convention Parliament]].
*[[1689]] &ndash; The 23rd Regiment of Foot or [[Royal Welch Fusiliers]] is founded.
*[[1782]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: Spanish troops [[Battle of Roatán|capture]] the British-held island of [[Roatán]].
*[[1792]] &ndash; King [[Gustav III of Sweden]] is shot; he dies on [[March 29]].
*[[1802]] &ndash; The [[United States Army Corps of Engineers|Army Corps of Engineers]] is established to found and operate the [[United States Military Academy|United States Military Academy at West Point]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[Battle of Badajoz (1812)|Battle of Badajoz]] (March 16   &ndash; April 6) &ndash; [[Great Britain|British]] and [[Portugal|Portuguese]] forces besieged and defeated [[France|French]] garrison during [[Peninsular War]].
*[[1815]] &ndash; [[William I of the Netherlands|Prince Willem]] proclaims himself King of the [[United Kingdom of the Netherlands]], the first [[constitutional monarchy|constitutional monarch]] in the [[Netherlands]].
*[[1818]] &ndash; In the [[Second Battle of Cancha Rayada]], [[Spain|Spanish]] forces defeated [[Chile]]ans under [[José de San Martín]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[Edward Clark (governor)|Edward Clark]] becomes [[List of Governors of Texas|Governor]] of [[Texas]], replacing [[Sam Houston]], who has been evicted from the office for refusing to take an oath of loyalty to the [[Confederate States of America|Confederacy]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: During the [[Red River Campaign]], [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] troops reach [[Alexandria, Louisiana]].
*[[1865]] &ndash; American Civil War: The [[Battle of Averasborough]] began as Confederate forces suffer irreplaceable casualties in the final months of the war.
*[[1872]] &ndash; The [[Wanderers F.C.]] won the first [[FA Cup]], the oldest [[association football|football]] competition in the world, beating [[Royal Engineers A.F.C.]] 1-0 at [[The Oval]] in [[Kennington]], [[London]].
*[[1900]] &ndash; Sir [[Arthur Evans]] purchased the land around the ruins of [[Knossos]], the largest [[Bronze Age]] [[List of archaeological sites sorted by country|archaeological site]] on [[Crete]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[Lawrence Oates]], an ill member of [[Robert Falcon Scott]]'s [[South Pole]] expedition, left his tent to die, saying: "I am just going outside and may be some time."
*[[1916]] &ndash; The 7th and 10th US cavalry regiments under [[John J. Pershing]] cross the [[US-Mexico border]] to join the hunt for [[Pancho Villa]].
*[[1924]] &ndash; In accordance with the [[Treaty of Rome, 1924|Treaty of Rome]], [[Rijeka|Fiume]] becomes annexed as part of [[Italy]].
*[[1926]] &ndash; [[Rocket#Modern rocketry|History of Rocketry]]: [[Robert Goddard (scientist)|Robert Goddard]] launches the first liquid-fueled [[rocket]], at [[Auburn, Massachusetts]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; [[Adolf Hitler]] orders [[Germany]] to rearm herself in violation of the [[Treaty of Versailles]]. Conscription is reintroduced to form the [[Wehrmacht]].
*[[1936]] &ndash; Warmer-than-normal temperatures rapidly melt snow and ice on the upper [[Allegheny River|Allegheny]] and [[Monongahela River|Monongahela]] rivers and lead to [[Pittsburgh Flood of 1936|a major flood]] in [[Pittsburgh]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; From [[Prague Castle]], Hitler proclaims [[Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia|Bohemia and Moravia]] a German [[protectorate]].
*  1939   &ndash; Marriage of Princess [[Princess Fawzia Fuad of Egypt|Fawzia of Egypt]] to Shah [[Mohammad Reza Pahlavi of Iran]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; First person killed in a German bombing raid on the UK in [[World War II]] during a raid on [[Scapa Flow]] in the [[Orkney Islands]], James Isbister.
*[[1942]] &ndash; The first [[V-2 rocket]] test launch. It exploded at lift-off.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Battle of Iwo Jima]] ended, but small pockets of [[Japan]]ese resistance persisted.
*  1945   &ndash; Ninety percent of [[Würzburg]], Germany is destroyed in only 20 minutes by [[United Kingdom|British]] bombers. 5,000 are killed.
*[[1950]] &ndash; Communist [[Czechoslovakia]]'s ministry of foreign affairs asks nuncios of [[Holy See|Vatican]] to leave the country.
*[[1958]] &ndash; The [[Ford Motor Company]] produces its 50 millionth automobile, the [[Ford Thunderbird|Thunderbird]], averaging almost a million cars a year since the company's founding.
*[[1962]] &ndash; A [[Flying Tiger Line]] [[Lockheed Constellation|Super Constellation]] [[Flying Tiger Line Flight 739|disappears]] in the western [[Pacific Ocean]], with all 107 aboard missing and presumed dead.
*[[1966]] &ndash; Launch of [[Gemini 8]], the 12th manned [[United States|American]] space flight and first space docking with the [[Agena Target Vehicle]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: In the [[My Lai massacre]], between 347 and 500 [[Vietnam]]ese villagers (men, women, and children) are killed by American troops.
*  1968   &ndash; [[General Motors]] produces its 100 millionth automobile, the [[Oldsmobile Toronado]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; A [[Viasa]] [[McDonnell Douglas DC-9]] [[Viasa Flight 742|crashes]] in [[Maracaibo]], Venezuela, killing 155.
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|British Prime Minister]] [[Harold Wilson]] resigns, citing personal reasons.
*[[1977]] &ndash; Assassination of [[Kamal Jumblatt]], the main leader of the anti-government forces in the [[Lebanese Civil War]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; Former [[Italy|Italian]] Prime Minister [[Aldo Moro]] is kidnapped and later killed by his captors.
*  1978   &ndash; Supertanker ''[[Amoco Cadiz]]'' splits in two after running aground on the Portsall Rocks, three miles off the coast of [[Brittany]], resulting in the 5th-largest [[oil spill]] in history.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Sino-Vietnamese War]]: The [[People's Liberation Army]] crosses the border back into China, ends the war.
*[[1983]] &ndash; Demolition of the [[Transmitter Ismaning|radio tower Ismaning]], the last wooden radio tower in Germany.
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[William Francis Buckley|William Buckley]], the [[CIA]] station chief in [[Beirut]], [[Lebanon]], is kidnapped by [[Islam]]ic fundamentalists and later died in captivity.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[Associated Press]] newsman [[Terry A. Anderson|Terry Anderson]] is taken hostage in [[Beirut]]. He is released on December 4, 1991.
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Iran-Contra Affair]]: Lieutenant Colonel [[Oliver North]] and Vice Admiral [[John Poindexter]] are indicted on charges of [[conspiracy (crime)|conspiracy]] to defraud the United States.
*  1988   &ndash; [[Halabja poison gas attack]]: The [[Kurd]]ish town of [[Halabjah]] in [[Iraq]] is attacked with a mix of [[poison gas]] and [[nerve agent]]s on the orders of Saddam Hussein, killing 5000 people and injuring about 10000 people.
*  1988   &ndash; [[The Troubles]]: [[Ulster loyalism|Ulster loyalist]] militant [[Michael Stone (loyalist)|Michael Stone]] [[Milltown Cemetery attack|attacks]] a [[Provisional IRA]] funeral in [[Belfast]] with pistols and grenades. Three people are killed and more than 60 wounded. The attack was filmed by news crews.
*[[1989]] &ndash; In [[Egypt]], a 4,400-year-old [[mummy]] is found near the [[Great Pyramid of Giza|Pyramid of Cheops]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Mississippi]] formally ratifies the [[Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution|Thirteenth Amendment]], becoming the last state to approve the abolition of [[slavery]].  The Thirteenth Amendment was officially ratified in 1865.
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Rachel Corrie]], a 23-year-old American woman involved with the [[International Solidarity Movement]], is killed trying to prevent a Palestinian home from being destroyed by a bulldozer in [[Rafah]].
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Israel]] officially hands over [[Jericho]] to Palestinian control.
*[[2014]] &ndash; [[Crimea]] votes in a controversial [[Crimean referendum, 2014|referendum]] to secede from [[Ukraine]] to join [[Russia]].
